chargeHist.descr: Arson of Property Other Than Building

result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody Michael Schwan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cody Michael Schwan is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Cody Michael Schwan was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Arson of Property Other Than Building

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 1 and 2.
Defendant to report to Probation by April 9, 2015.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.
Defendant is eligible for expungement after successful completion of probation but must petition the Court.

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 3 Case #14CF473.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 3 Case #14CF473.

-Defendant to participate in the Restorative Justice Program.
-Defendant to follow recommended treatment from assessments.
-Submit to any testing the Agent may require.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Defendant to obtain his HS diploma.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

records.addlTxt: Reason for Change: Terminated - Regular.       Restitution = $0.00, Court Obs = $0.00 and Supv fees = $80.00. eif
of Conviction. Signed by SRN on 3/2/2016. c/f: Probation. km
to Rebecca Johnson ck# 024603 sent this date. eif
c: Def, Atty, DA, SCSO & E: Probation. eif
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Alex Stormont   DF:  Cody Michael Schwan appeared. Case called at 4:33. ADA Nieskes updates the court as to agreement.  Atty. Stormont agrees. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 3  in the amended complaint of 14CF473. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 3 of the amended complaint in 14CF473. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1 and 2 in 14CF473. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. Restitution of $100 has been paid. Crt orders: Sentence W/H  1 yr. probation with the following conditions:
- DE to participate in restorative justice. 
- DE complete AODA assessment.
- DE to follow recommended treatment from assessment.
- Submit to any testing the agent may require.
-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. 
- DE to obtain his HS diploma.
- Costs
- Costs of supervision.
DE eligible for expungement. 
DE to report to to probation by 4:00pm April 9, 2015. Bond will be discharged at that time.
Payment to the victim shall be disbursed.
Plea hearing on April 8, 2015 at 04:30 pm.
Plea hearing on March 24, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: M. Nieskes : Alex Stormont DF: Cody Michael Schwan appeared. Case called at 3:27 set for PTC. ADA Nieskes updates the court. ADA Nieskes believes this could be amended to a misdemeanor charge. There is restitution of $300, $100 up front if joint and several. Atty. Stormont request a month for DE to secure pmt. Bond continues in form and amount.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
and Demand for Discovery and Inspection filed by Atty. A. Stormont. gme
Pre-trial conference on February 3, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Rebecca J. or her residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Matthew L. Hartung,  DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,  DF:  Cody Michael Schwan appeared. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Request prelim. Waives speedy prelim.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
filed by ADA Kenneth Sortedahl. eif
